channel.title: Opening JAR files
channel.description: I fucked up something on my other computer and now when I open JAR files, a command prompt opens for a millisecond then closes. What file is used to open JAR files? C:\program files\java\jdk1.7.0_03\java.exe is not it. It's also not my JDK version, because I tried jre7, jre6, jdk1.6.0_18, jdk1.6.0_20, 23, and 27. The only way I can open JAR files is by saving a .bat file that executes the JAR by using java.exe. So when I press Open With..., what is the directory of the file I use to open the JAR file?

item.title: Opening JAR files
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Not been able to replicate the issue so I just went and deleted the VM, sorry.

Read full topic

item.title: Opening JAR files
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

zyle1992:

If youi’re having trouble opening a jar, try running it under some hot water. If that doesn’t work, grab a butter knife (or another utensil) and dent the lid around the sides.

Trollololololol. Nice one.

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:9, topic:439184”][quote author=Fridder link=topic=541885.msg3970263#msg3970263 date=1334084832]
Windows Vista with SP 2.
[/quote]
I’ll go grab my Vista CD and see if I can replicate the issue then.[/quote]

Any luck? Just right click, open as, and open it as anything then try to reopen it with Java.

Read full topic

item.title: Opening JAR files
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

zyle1992:

If youi’re having trouble opening a jar, try running it under some hot water. If that doesn’t work, grab a butter knife (or another utensil) and dent the lid around the sides.

Great read. Method one didn’t work so well but the second method worked instantly! Thank you. ++

item.title: Opening JAR files
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:6, topic:439184”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=541885.msg3970238#msg3970238 date=1334083610]
It should work by:
Right click >
Open With >
Choose default program >
Find “javaw.exe” in your JRE installation (not jdk)
Press OK >
??? >
Profit!
[/quote]

Didn’t work.[/quote]
Hmm, what OS are you using? That’s what I had to do after changing from JRE6_u12 to JRE7_u2 on Windows 7
